runs.comm: play and a miss. Feet glued to the crease as he pushes at an away swinger without any conviction
sweetly timed, slapped into the gap behind point. Shanaka runs around from third man and throws in a dive to stop that. Poor running, should have been more than just two
back of length delivery on middle and leg, hit high on the thigh pad as he looks to whip it away
looks to slash that over point, can't get bat to ball again
jags away off the deck from length area on middle, he pokes and misses
gets some lift off the deck, he hops back and bunts it back down the pitch
pierces the gap between cover and point. Delightful backfoot punch. Allowing the ball to slide onto the bat as he essayed a classic stoke. Nice high elbow as bat met ball. Superb to watch
walks across, maybe that put the bowler off, floats it well outside the wide line
gets half forward and taps it towards point
firm push but straight to point
solid punch in that stroke again, straight to point
gets a thick inside edge past square leg
he's picked that from leg stump and deposited that into the deep square leg region. Superb wrist work, some steel in those
jags back in to beat his inside edge, ball deflects off his right thigh
plays back to a delivery he could have prodded forward, point fielder swoops in
thick edge, Herath is lightning quick across the turf at third man
on middle and leg, looks to whip it away, missed it as he was late on the stroke
beaten; looks to flay that between cover and point. Bat came down at an angle
big inside edge saved him, else he would have been a dead duck. The ball was full and tailing in from middle and off
poor start. Width on offer and he cashes in. Backs away, makes room and slaps it behind point. What sound as he made contact. Sitting up nicely and had 'hit me' written all over it
gets outside the line of the stumps and sweeps it with the spin into the backward square leg boundary

soft dismissal, there's the revenge. Hafeez looks to go downtown but didn't get to the pitch, checked his stroke at the last moment as the ball lobs off the splice to the bowler, who accepts it gleefully.
poor ball and put away. Can't ask for a better delivery first up as a batsman. Slides it across the batsman from round the stumps, he lends direction by easing it wide of point
flicked wide of midwicket
drifting into middle and leg, defended
crunching drive. Width on offer, he hits that through the line without a trace of worry, delightful timing
eased wide of point, Rangana is quick to get around from fine third man
yorker-length delivery on middle, squeezed back to the bowler
too full and just around off, powerfully driven but straight to mid-off
top effort by Thisara at mid-on, diving full length to his right to stop a certain boundary
throws his bat at a drivable delivery, missed the edge as it nipped away late
the extra pace of Chameera! Floats a length ball across the batsman, who drives and misses. Not much feet movement there
pulls across the line but mistimes it to midwicket
shades of Sanath Jayasuriya in that one. Offers the full face of the bat and lofts the full ball on middle over mid-on
biffed that into the midwicket region where Siriwardena dives over the ball, he probably slipped a bit. Made great movement, but got locked up. Poor technique
up and over the infield again, this one flies off a thick inside edge, but the intent to clear the mid-on fielder was made very clear as he went powerfully at it, good willow that
squeezed behind point, third man was a spectator. He hardly moved as the ball raced away into the boundary
one bounce to the point fielder
arm ball that slides back in to cramp him, pushed wide of midwicket
pulled, one bounce into the deep midwicket fence. Picked the short ball early and muscled the pull. He's timing them really well
one bounce to long-on, flat hit
dabs it wide of cover for a quick single
full toss on middle, driven to long-off

he can't do much wrong, can he? Floats a short ball on middle, Sharjeel can't time the pull, gets it high on the bat as long-on takes the easiest of catches. Looked to go a lot square, but didn't position himself well as he made contact.
appeal for lbw, a big one at that, as the ball spins back in sharply past the inside edge. Hit him on the back pad, they scoot a leg-bye. Would have gone over
how has that missed the stumps? He plays for the turn but this one skids on, keeps low as well. Excellent take
superb stop off his own bowling
worked off his pad to square leg
misfield at midwicket gives them a run, Dilshan isn't happy
lunges forward and plays it back to the bowler
tucked wide of midwicket
gets a thin bottom edge as he attempts a sweep, picked up by short fine leg
pushed through quicker, lands it on middle and off, defended with soft hands
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it towards midwicket
appeal for lbw again, an inside edge may have saved him there. Little doubt as to where the ball was headed though
rides the bounce and eases it down to third man
stands tall and punches it to deep point
crunching drive, but straight to the sweeper
looks to flay that on the up past extra cover, misses
sweet sound as he made contact with that cover drive, called for two the moment he hit it
runs it down to third man, better over after a horror start

that will release the pressure that has been building for a while. Steps out, but Herath cleverly shortens his length. Doesn't matter as Sarfraz hits through the line with power, splits the gap between deep cover and long off
chips down the track and wrists this with his bottom hand to get it wide of long-on, what timing
sharp turn away, gets a leading edge, no damage done, rushes to point
tapped wide of cover for a quick single
worked with the angle to long on
backs away, bowler follows him, bunted to cover for a single, a direct hit from Dilshan at the bowler's end and he was gone
pulled, but didn't get hold of it entirely, rolls to long-on
leans into the drive, caressed to sweeper cover

ball has flown off the blade. It was full and wide outside off, he opened the bat face late and squeezed it wide of point, the dew allowed the ball to gain steam, another unsuccessful dive over the ball by third man, Thisara isn't amused
firm push to deep cover
gets onto his toes and whips it to deep square
short, width and crunched. Both feet up in the air as he makes contact, cut up and over the infield
almost carried to the bowler
driven with the spin to the bowler
quicker one on middle, gets across and blocks it
worked wide of midwicket for an easy single
as easy as they come as far as decisions go. Too full, shaped to sweep but was done in by the length. Once he missed, there was little doubt as to where that was headed
driven with the spin to cover
pushed wide of midwicket
picks the length early and pulls it towards deep square
punched wide of midwicket
drifting into middle and leg, whipped towards deep midwicket
got too close to the ball, but managed to squeeze it to long-off
crunching drive, straight to sweeper cover
the delicate dab does the trick. Fired it outside off, he rocks back and angles it past short third man, good work by Kulasekara. Chasing it down right till the end and then pulling it back in
driven into the gap at wide long-off
buffet bowling, as Geoff Boycott would say. Too short, enough time for Akmal to rock back and pull that into the gap at deep midwicket. Set himself up early and struck it off the middle
another freebie, put away exactly at the same spot, one bounce over the ropes. Can't bowl that short and expect to get away.
played back to the bowler
what a shot! When he's on song, he can be delightful to watch. Gets to the pitch and crashes that into the gap between deep cover and long-off. No slogging so far today, clean hitting
cuts back in to beat the inside edge
stands tall and bunts it towards cover, Malik wanted the single but his partner wasn't ready
using the pace and width to steer it towards third man
punched towards deep point
leg-cutter on that occasion, disguised nicely, Malik misses the dab, one bounce to the keeper
gets behind the line and blocks
beautiful shot. Slower and fuller outside off, he waits and waits and then lofts it cleanly over extra cover
too full on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
doesn't get the elevation he hoped for, flat hit, one bounce to long-on
whipped to deep square
yorker length outside off, squeezed to long-on
gets back and defends
width on offer, he backs away and then reaches out for it, toe-ends it to sweeper cover
flirting with that wide line, Akmal backed away to carve it over point, missed. Touch harsh, line call

beaten by the legcutter, bounces in front of Dickwella who fails to collect it cleanly, deflects it into the third man bouncer. Misread the bounce completely, didn't get his body behind the ball either
crunched but straight to cover
lofted over cover but his heart would have been in his mouth, falls in no man's land. It was the slower one, the bat face turned in his hand as he made contact
full toss, a high one at that, picked the gap well enough, there was a fielder there but he had to dive across the turf to pull it back in, unfortunately it wasn't a full-blooded effort
slower one outside off, guides it to point
floats it full on middle, worked towards deep midwicket
excellent yorker, jams his bat down in time to keep that out
gets a thick inside edge as long on swoops in
right into the blockhole again, gets it down to long on
that would have cleared any boundary in the world. Full, he set himself up nicely, clean bat swing and boom. What power!

outstanding, simply wow. This was a flat hit over the infield, Thisara, at wide long-off, started running almost as soon as Akmal made contact, it was a flat hit and Thisara simply threw his hands up as he moved to his right, did well to hold on even as the momentum threatened to knock him back. He slid over, showed excellent balance. Superb athleticism.
full and dead straight on off, defended

dropped at mid-off.  Could have added to the drama. It was full, drilled hard to Kulasekara, who grabbed at it, bobbled out as they complete the run. Looked like Kula was confused for a split second, went Aussie style and burst out of his hand to nearly hit him on the face
